author: Xebialabs
description: Create, upload and deploy artifacts to XL Deploy server.
helpMarkDown:
This build task enables you to create a deployment archive package (DAR package), import it to your XL Deploy server, and trigger a deployment.

Ensure that the manifest file path points to a file in your source control.

If no endpoints are defined, you need to create one. For XL Deploy, use a generic endpoint option.

inputs.helpMarkDown: Set the path to the manifest file that needs to be used to compose your deployment archive; for example, $/MyApplication/src/deployit-manifest.xml.
inputs.label: Manifest Path
inputs.name: manifestPath

inputs.helpMarkDown: Publish your DAR package as a named artifact for the current pipeline.
inputs.label: Publish as Pipeline Artifact
inputs.name: publish

inputs.helpMarkDown: If you want to provide a specific value that should be set in your manifest file, use a placeholder and provide it with this option.
inputs.label: Version
inputs.name: version

inputs.helpMarkDown: Triggers the deployment toward a specified environment after the import succeeds.
inputs.label: Deploy
inputs.name: deploy

inputs.helpMarkDown: Environment name as specified in XL Deploy.
inputs.label: Target Environment
inputs.name: targetEnvironment

inputs.helpMarkDown: Invoke a rollback in the case of deployment failure.
inputs.label: Rollback on deployment failure
inputs.name: rollback

inputs.helpMarkDown: If you want DAR packages to be delivered in a folder other than the default (Staging folder), specify the folder path.
inputs.label: Output Folder
inputs.name: outputFolder

inputs.helpMarkDown: If the root folder for your archive is different than the default (Staging folder), specify a valid path.
inputs.label: Package root folder
inputs.name: rootFolder

inputs.helpMarkDown: If you intend to use a different value than the default $(Build.BuildNumber), specify it here.
inputs.label: Version value override
inputs.name: versionNumber

name: XLDeploy
